title: SNP Matrix Bugs/Feature
body:
- Type of SNP coming up as None for a few positions instead of coding/non-coding
- Add gene id after functional class annotation.
- Resolve SNP/Indel at the same position annotations. No. of "|" fields.
- Phaster get JSON file gets outdated. 
- Increase RAxML walltime from 76 to 250 Hrs.

title: Variant Calling Pipeline Bugs/Feature
body:
- Adding Depth of coverage filter to the pipeline.
- Require Phaster results under reference genome directory.
- Turning on cleanup argument of the pipeline. This will rearrange the variant calling -All step results for each sample and remove intermediate files.

title: naming of pre- and post- gubbins files
body: Zena and I chatted: Can we please remove gubbins from the names of files that have NOT had gubbins run on them yet? It's very confusing to have a gubbins.fa file that is not recombination filtered. @alipirani88

title: variant matrix code numbers
body: it's confusing that some "bad" sites (filtered) are positive numbers (2) and the rest are negative. Can we make this number schema more meaningful? To discuss with @alipirani88 @zmml

title: unmask phage variants in variant matrix code files
body:
Change masked phage variants (-2's) to whatever the actual variant call is.

Then when we update the numbers, we can have -2 be filtered variants (the old 2).

Specific files:
SNP_mat_code
Indel_mat_code

title: Final Results folder directory sctructure
body: The prefix being used in updated/newest results folder follow the old prefix names. It should have the same name as the results directory name.

title: Brief Read me type file for each iteration of the pipeline run
body:
A brief iteration describing why an updated iteration of pipeline was run, what parameters were used, who asked you to run.

o   Date of run/version of pipeline

o   High level description for why variant set was generated

o   High level description of filters applied

o   Indel inclusion

Variant QC folder results

- Add sequencing depth results

title: Incorporate outgroup inclusion in analysis.
Add an optional outgroup flag/option into the gubbins job generating script.
Downsample coverage to 100X: generate a test data from high coverage datasets
Generates a wrong prefix if the alignment fasta file path has "." character. script name: gubbins_iqtree_raxml.sh
Integrating variant QC script into the pipeline.
body:
- Package loading conflict issues: The packages used in the script conflicts with current flux R version. This could be solved by adding an additional step of automatically installed the required package or mention all the compatible package versions.
- Hard coded Path errors.

title: Generate non-gubbins tree; run Raxml and Iqtree on pre-gubbins filtered alignment.
Resolving Branch length issues specific to outgroup inclusion.
body:
- Generate two input alignments with and without outgroup.
- Run gubbins on without outgroup alignment .
- Use Zena's mask_positions function to mask gubbins recombinant positions in the input alignment with outgroup (original) to generate a new masked alignment. Then use this masked alignment as an input to iqtree.
- Zena will add a parameter to select user specified model in iqtree.
- Update IQtree installation. Maintain old versions too.

title: low fq AND low mq in code matrix
body: Can we have a number corresponding to both low FQ and low MQ in the code matrices?

title: Feature Addition: Outgroup option
body:
1. Remove current outgroup functionality i.e using outgroup alignment in gubbins WGA input.
2. Run gubbins without an outgroup.
3. Run Zena's script that masks recombinant positions from the WGA alignment (that also contains an outgroup). script located here: /nfs/esnitkin/Github/scripts/python/gubbins_iqtree.py
4. use the masked WGA output from the script to run Iqtree.

title: I/O performance issues
body: temp_generate_position_label_data_matrix_All_label function takes up high amount of memory to process the intermediate label matrix file.

title: Indel row name issue?
body:
I have the following rowname in my Cd ST2 indel matrix: 

`"Non-Coding Indel at 82614 > AATAGATT,AATAGATTATAGATTATAGATT,A,AATAGATTATAGATTATAGATTATAGATT,AATAGATTATAGATTATAGATTATAGATTATAGATT functional=NULL_NULL_NULL locus_tag=CWR55_RS00575-CWR55_RS00580 Strand Information: CWR55_RS00575=+/CWR55_RS00580=+/;AATAGATTATAGATTATAGATT|intergenic_region|MODIFIER|CWR55_RS00575-CWR55_RS00580|n.82614_82615insATAGATTATAGATTATAGATT||||CWR55_RS00575-CWR55_RS00580|CWR55_RS00575-CWR55_RS00580;A|intergenic_region|MODIFIER|CWR55_RS00575-CWR55_RS00580|n.82615_82621delATAGATT||||CWR55_RS00575-CWR55_RS00580|CWR55_RS00575-CWR55_RS00580;AATAGATTATAGATT|intergenic_region|MODIFIER|CWR55_RS00575-CWR55_RS00580|n.82614_82615insATAGATTATAGATT||||CWR55_RS00575-CWR55_RS00580|CWR55_RS00575-CWR55_RS00580;"`

It has 3 separate annotations: 1) AATAGATTATAGATTATAGATT, 2) A, and 3) AATAGATTATAGATT. 

However, the row contains 6 different alleles:  A, AATAGATT, AATAGATTATAGATT, AATAGATTATAGATTATAGATT, AATAGATTATAGATTATAGATTATAGATT, AATAGATTATAGATTATAGATTATAGATTATAGATT. 

Is the lack of annotations for the other alleles an issue with variant calling or generating the row name?

Relevant file: Line 76 of
`/nfs/esnitkin/Project_Cdiff/Sequence_data/U01_supplement_014_027_genomes/consensus/2018_08_15_U01_variant_sets/2019_09_26_U01_O14_ST2_Public_variant_calling/2019_11_18_11_18_56_core_results/data_matrix/matrices/Indel_matrix_allele.csv `

title: Remove gene symbol and insert Locus Tag in field 4
body:
> sigK



> Change pipe-delimited field 4 to ALWAYS be locus tag, and NEVER gene symbol. Currently, the gene symbol is reported if there is a gene symbol, else the locus tag is reported.
> 
> Particularly when lines with multiple annotations are split on to separate row, this makes it impossible to cross reference the gene symbol to the strand information. In this case, I don't know what gene symbol sig K is.
> 
> "Coding SNP at 1431118 > C functional=NULL_NULL_NULL locus_tag=CD630_12310-CD630_12300 Strand Information: CD630_12310=-/CD630_12300=-/;C|missense_variant|MODERATE|CD630_12310|c.119A>G|p.Asn40Ser|119/1518|40/505|null or hypothetical protein,sigK|putative site-specific recombinase,Sigma K,;C|intron_variant|MODIFIER|sigK|c.391-1437A>G||||null or hypothetical protein,sigK|putative site-specific recombinase,Sigma K,;"
> 
> Also, sometimes the annotation is in pipe-delimited field 4 instead of locus tag or gene symbol
> "Non-Coding SNP at 5393980 > T functional=NULL_NULL_NULL locus_tag=KPNIH1_26385 Strand Information: KPNIH1_26385=-;T|intergenic_region|MODIFIER|KPNIH1_26385-null or hypothetical protein|n.5393980A>T||||null or hypothetical protein|hypothetical protein;"

Remove gene symbol and insert Locus Tag.

_Originally posted by @alipirani88 in https://github.com/alipirani88/variant_calling_pipeline/issues/15#issuecomment-540116128_

title: SNP mat and Indel mat .csv --> .tsv
body: Please save SNP and indel matrices as .tsv (they're being saved as .csv, but they are actually tab-deliminted).

title: When a SNV is present in multiple genes (in this case 3 genes), only 2 locus tags/strand info are listed and not 3 -- here: CD630_18440, CD630_18560, CD630_18550
add documentation using only gubbins + iqtree
body:
Hi Ali,
Could you please add documentation for how we can just use the gubbins+iqtree portion of the pipeline? The input would be a whole genome multi fasta alignment. This is useful for when we want to drop sequences from an alignment and re-make a recombination filtered tree but don't need to call variants again. 
Thanks,
Arianna

title: Remove the need to update binbase: path in config file and autiomatically search the installed executables.
create a more simple/generalizable example config file
body: The current example config file is a bit overwhelming and not generalizable outside the lab. It would be nice to have a simpler example version that makes clear what pieces are essential vs. optional.

title: remove trailing underscore from the end of sample names
body: The jobs names and later sample names have an underscore at the end of the id (such as `CDIF_SB_1005_.sbat`). It would be great to remove this so we don't have to drop it downstream when merging with metadata.
